```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

```{r, echo=FALSE}
library(qicharts2)
library(qcc)
```

Create y = normal random varaible of 24 datapoints with a seed value of 7, then introduce an outlier of 5. 
```{r}
set.seed(7)
y = rnorm(24)
y[18] = 5
```

Plot the control chart: 
```{r}
qic(y, chart = 'i')
```

```{r}
data = read.csv("H:\\Datasets\\Cerner\\KPI Downloads\\dailies\\2018\\October\\daily_core_metrics.csv")

head(data)
ATRT = data["Average.Transaction.Response.Time"]
ATRT_1 = ATRT[1:30,]
ATRT_2 = ATRT[31:60,]
ATRT_3 = ATRT[61:90,]
ATRT_baseline = ATRT[1:90,]
head(ATRT)

#length(ATRT_baseline)
## ATRT_baseline = qcc.groups(ATRT_baseline)

CCAll = qic(ATRT_baseline, chart = 'i')

CC1 = qic(ATRT_1, chart = 'i') 
CC2 = qic(ATRT_2, chart = 'i') 
CC3 = qic(ATRT_3, chart = 'i')

CC1
CC2
CC3
CCAll

```



## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
